sentence.idiomatic: As soon as he finished his performance, everyone applauded "clap, clap, clap."
The gun made a "bang" sound.
I just heard a "boom", and the building collapsed.
There was a "click". He hung up the phone.
When I heard his words, my heart thumped, and I had a kind of ominous premonition.
There was a "crash", and the sink fell down onto the floor.
I didn't eat breakfast today. Now I'm so hungry that my stomach is growling.

word.literal: from an exchange of blows friendship grows

sentence.idiomatic: Ha ha, the two of us are like the saying: "from an exchange of blows, friendship grows."
"hee hee", she laughed, with a mysterious look on her face.
How come the entire day you have been foolishly giggling "hee hee?"
His exaggerated expressions made us laugh "ha ha" all day.
Humph, you want to trick us again? No way.
The children couldn't find their mother, and cried "wah wah."
Immediately upon seeing his funny costume, the audience below the stage started to laugh in a hubbub.
The door was slammed closed with an emphatic "bang".
The birds outside the window chirped and twittered, waking him up.
She took the scissors and with a little "snap" cut off the long hair.
I just heard a rustle and the things in the bag fell to the ground.
It was extremely quiet in the room, you could only hear the ticking of the clock.
When other people eat the soup they don't make noise, it's only him that always slurps while eating.
We were walking uphill following the mountain path, and after a little while we heard the gurgling sound of water flowing.
The time passed by with a "whoosh".
smack, bang, boom, roar (of a crowd)
clack, click, thump
sound of a gong
gurgling sound, slurping sound, dripping sound, sound of flowing water, sound of the patter of rain
ha ha, hee hee, heh heh, huh huh, hum hum
slam (of a large door)
sound of birds chirping
whoosh
